H0.text: The rotation of Earth is the cause of most earthquakes.

H1.text: The direction of the wind is the cause of most earthquakes.

H2.text: The pull of Earth's gravity is the cause of most earthquakes.

H3.text: The movement of plates on Earth's crust is the cause of most earthquakes.

A4.text: Faults tend to be geologically active, experiencing earthquakes, volcanic activity, mountain-building, and oceanic trench formation.

A5.text: Transform faults occur across a spreading center. Strong earthquakes can occur along a fault.
